title: Strange output for BCELoss and BCEWithLogitsLoss
body_html:
When I use these two loss function or nn modules, they give strange outputs for some extreme values.

Example 1 for BCELoss
input = torch.autograd.Variable(torch.Tensor([1,1]))
target = torch.augograd.Variable(torch.Tensor([0,0]))
loss1 = torch.nn.BCELoss()
a1 = loss1(input,taget)
The output
a1 = 27.6310
It is very strange. Is the limit of BCELoss is 1e12?

Example 2 for BCEWithLogitsLoss
input = torch.autograd.Variable(torch.Tensor([8e7,8e7]))
target = torch.augograd.Variable(torch.Tensor([0,0]))
loss0 = torch.nn.BCEWithLogitsLoss()
a0 = loss0(input,taget)
The output
a0 = 8e7
Why?
